Package io.github.eutro.wasm2j.embed

Class Memory.HandleMemory

java.lang.Object
io.github.eutro.wasm2j.embed.Memory.HandleMemory
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExternVal, Memory
Enclosing interface:
Memory
public static class Memory.HandleMemory extends Object implements Memory
A memory which delegates its calls to the provided method handles.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Memory.HandleMemory create(@Nullable @Nullable Integer max, MethodHandle loadHandle, MethodHandle storeHandle, MethodHandle size, MethodHandle grow, MethodHandle init)
      Create a handle memory with the given maximum and handles.
      Parameters:
      max - The maximum number of pages, or null if unbounded.
      loadHandle - The storeHandle(StoreMode) implementation.
      storeHandle - The storeHandle(StoreMode) implementation.
      size - The size() implementation.
      grow - The grow(int) implementation.
      init - The init(int, int, int, ByteBuffer) implementation.
      Returns:
      The new memory.

    • loadHandle

      public MethodHandle loadHandle(Memory.LoadMode mode)
      Description copied from interface: Memory
      Get a method handle which loads with the specific mode.

      The handle should accept one integer argument: the memory address; it should return the appropriate type according to the mode.

      Specified by:
      loadHandle in interface Memory
      Parameters:
      mode - The mode.
      Returns:
      The handle.

    • storeHandle

      public MethodHandle storeHandle(Memory.StoreMode mode)
      Description copied from interface: Memory
      Get a method handle which stores with the specific mode.

      The handle should accept an integer argument: the memory address, and the value, dependent upon the mode; it should return void.

      Specified by:
      storeHandle in interface Memory
      Parameters:
      mode - The mode.
      Returns:
      The handle.

    • grow

      public int grow(int growByPages)
      Description copied from interface: Memory
      Grow the memory by a number of pages, filling new pages with 0.

      This operation is allowed to fail (and must fail if the upper limit is exceeded), in which case -1 should be returned.

      Specified by:
      grow in interface Memory
      Parameters:
      growByPages - The number of pages to grow by, interpreted as an unsigned integer.
      Returns:
      The old size, or -1 if the memory was not grown.
      See Also:
      • Opcodes.PAGE_SIZE

      Description copied from interface: Memory
      Initialise the memory with the given data.
      Specified by:
      init in interface Memory
      Parameters:
      dstIdx - The destination address in this memory.
      srcIdx - The start address in buf.
      len - The number of bytes to copy.
      buf - The buffer of data.
